title: Serial reaction chamber
content:
The chamber can be used to observe small rodents response to light stimulus. 
It has holes with a light on one end and a feeding slot with a light in the opposite end. Depending on the behavoiur being experimented the animal needs to poke it's nose into the correct hole and feeding occurs in accordance to the experiemntal rules.
Its an implementation of a complete behavioural box using BeeHive, off the shelf components and 3D printed parts.

Hardware:

Beehive components
ESP32 + central hub


supporting hardware
Reaction Chamber
Home chamber
feeder



Software:

micropython on the ESP32

python (or Bonsai) running data collection on PC.


To make the different part of the tool, look in to the following links:

Printing list
Food dispenser
Reaction chamber

Make sure you start by having the parts in the bill of materials (, ) page.

title: Bill of Materials
content:
Bill of Materials
Download this as a CSV file
Parts

1 Liquid Adhesive 
14 M3 hex Nut 
38 M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw 
8 M3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw 
1 Servo motor 

Tools

1 150mm mini hacksaw 
1 2mm Hex key 
1 M3 tap set 
1 Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver 
1 tap wrench 

Machine

2 3d printer 
2 Laser cutter 

Material

2 clear plastic sheet 
1 Flexible Tube 
1 maker beam XL 
500 g of PLA filament

title: Printing list
content:
Printing list
This page will contain instructions of things that need to be printed for this project.

title: Food dispenser
content: Food dispenser An automated feeding and storage tank for small animals during lab test. In this project its being used to reward the animal under test. After testing is done the feeding tank should be filled and programed to auto feed mode to ensure the animal is feed as per the diatery requirements. Parts 8 M3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw 1 Servo motor Tools 1 2mm Hex key 1 Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver Machine 1 3d printer 1 Laser cutter Material 1 clear plastic sheet 1 Flexible Tube 100 g of PLA filament You can skip step 1 and 2, if you have purchased the parts. Step 1: Printing parts Please follow the information on your slicing software and remember to add a brim where necessary. To accomplish this section you will need a 3d printer and PLA filament to print the following parts: Step 2: Laser cut parts To accomplish this section you will need a Laser cutter and clear plastic sheet to cut the following: Outer cover Inner cover Step 3: Assemble the parts Push the Servo motor on the 3d printed motor holder. Align the motor holder pillars with the tank base holes and fasten the assembly usingM3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw and use 2mm Hex key to tighten the screws. Make sure the through hole is at the oppsite side of the motor support hook. Align the feed throat with the two holes and the feed throat hole on the base. Then fasten the feed throat with M3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw and tighten uisng Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver. fit the rotor on the servo motor shaft and fasten it using the M3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw. screw the tank on to the tank base. MAke sure the tabs fit in the slots. place the outer cover and inner cover ontop of each other and align the holes with the cover handle. Then fasten them using the M3x8mm hex socket counter sunk screw on the cover handle hole. The lid can be placed ontop of the tank to cover the food. The Flexible Tube is then press fit on the fed throat. You made it!

title: Reaction chamber
content: Reaction chamber The chamber is used to track mice reaction time using light as a training cue. We will cover the step by step process of making the chamber in this section. 3d printer and Laser cutter are OPTIONAL. If you dont have them you can outsource the services from your local supplier. Parts 1 Liquid Adhesive 14 M3 hex Nut 38 M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw Tools 1 150mm mini hacksaw 1 M3 tap set 1 Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver 1 tap wrench Machine 1 3d printer 1 Laser cutter Material 1 clear plastic sheet 1 maker beam XL 400 g of PLA filament If you have outsourced the printed and laser cut parts. You migth need to inform your supplier to have PLA filament for printing and clear plastic sheet for laser cutting. Step 1: Electronics box Using a laser cutter, cut the following parts: 1 pc of Ecase_Back 1 pc of Ecase_Base 1 pc of Ecase_Front 2 pcs of Ecase_R&L Assemble the Electronics box with the laser cut parts to form a box then fasten the box with M3 hex Nut and M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw using Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver to tighten the nuts. Step 2: Electronics board Position the Pcb board in line with the holes on the side of the box assembly. Then using M3x8 Pozi pan machine screwfasten the board using Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver to tighten the screws. Step 3: Electronics cover Print the two models below Do not print the latch_assembly.stl as one part Snap fit the latch_handle.svg on to the latch_base.svg part to from the Latch_assembly. Locate the holes on the side of the box and using M3 hex Nut and M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw fasten the assembled latch to the box uisng Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver. Place the Electronics top on top of the box and fasten it using the latch assembly. Step 4: Maker beam frame Using 150mm mini hacksaw cut 2 pcs 200mm long and 6 pcs 150mm long from the maker beam XL From the M3 tap set place the taping screw on the tap wrench then make threads on the holes at the end of the maker beam xl pieces that you had cut ealier. Place 2 makerbeam xl 200mm and 150 mm end to end at their meeting point joing them together using corner. to make a square frame. Using M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw fasten the corners to the maker beam xl uisng Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver. Repeat the process for all the corners to make a rectangle. At the corners of the square frame fasten horizontally 4 more maker beam xl using M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw. Step 5: Adding the enclosure Slide the platform support parts on opposite sides of the pillars and on top of them place the Platform base. Slide the feeding wall making sure it goes all the way to the bottom. Then for the led series wall will slide up to the platform and on top of it slide the curved wall. . With the side entry wall press fit the tunnel connector and the tunnel clamp on either side of the plasric sheet. Slide the side entry wall and the side plain wall through the pillars of the box. With the lid pieces, hinge, trap latch and groove pins. Locate the holes on the lid and allign the hinge and latch then press fit the groove pins on the holes to fasten the latch and hinge on the clear sheet. Place the assembled lid on the box assembly. Then using M3x8 Pozi pan machine screw fasten the lid tightening the screws using Pozidriv PZ1 screw driver. On the bottom of the box along the makerbeam xl groove slide the guide rail and make sure it is at the middle and fits tightly. Step 6: Excrete panel Using the Excrete box case parts case back, case base,case front, case right, case left and Liquid Adhesive stick the parts together and waith for them to dry. Step 7: Putting things together Place the box assembly on top of the electronics case and close the latches to make the assembly stable. The assembled tray in should slid on the assembly in the assembly to make a collector for the animal excretion during experiment.
